Pre-Game Insights: England have dominated Greece historically, remaining undefeated in nine previous encounters, winning seven and drawing two.
Interim manager Lee Carsley aims to prove his credentials by leading the Three Lions in this Group B2 clash.
Both teams have secured victories over Ireland and Finland, but Greece edges out England on goal difference.
Captain Harry Kane is set to lead the line after recovering from an injury scare.
Injuries have forced Ezri Konsa, Kobbie Mainoo, and Morgan Gibbs-White to withdraw from the squad.
Dominic Solanke has been recalled for the first time in seven years, while Phil Foden, Jude Bellingham, and Kyle Walker are expected to feature.
Greece, despite being ranked 48th by FIFA, will look to challenge England with a disciplined defensive approach.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game will be broadcast live in the UK on ITV1, with live streaming available via the ITVX app.
A 48-hour no-obligation free trial is offered with LibertyShield.com for viewers needing a VPN to watch the match.
